column4: hi. i cant delete files via nautilus anymore (error). rm still works. anyone has a clue?
check free space on your disk, nautilus doesn't delete files, it moves them to trash can
hm was a good idea. 450M free though, should do it
how much you have in trash now?
what's the error message when you try to delete?
well translated its something like: not on same filesystem while deleting "/home/pc/blah.gif" Continue? (skip,cancel,again)
oh and skip or again does nothing. errormessage still shows
i'm looking at preferences that can be set for nautilus
you do have that partition mounted with write permissions yes?  maybe try deleting a file on another partition
the only things i could think of are users (not too smart) and automatic apt-get update and dist-upgrade
home is on the / partition. i'll try another though
if you can delete a file with rm on the same partition, that's not it actually...
what do you mean, that's not it?
oh permissions you mean. yeah you're right
it's just one of those things that always worked and for some reason not anymore now..
interesting. deleting something from hda2 does work without errors
yeah, i know what you mean, i'm trying to find that gconf program I think it was called that lets you view a bunch of preferences you can set.  Can't find it.
i never remember the name either. just type gconf and TAB :)

i can't find anything, i'd just try googling your exact error message, all in quotes.  But, you've have to leave out anything machine specific.  Like hdd, a partition name.  You tried google.com/linux also?
i translated the error, it's probably wrong :) if i know the original i
i'd search for it too
it's an error from gnome-vfs. rings any bells?
